intro: Phyllanthus tsetserrae, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
